title: Motorcyclist injured after hitting groundhog
content: ELMER TWP, MI -- A Sandusky man was hospitalized after the motorcycle he was riding struck a groundhog, throwing him off the bike.    The incident happened about 7:24 a.m. on Friday, June 1, on Isles Road near French Line Road in Sanilac County's Elmer Township.    Sheriff's deputies responded to the scene and discovered the 59-year-old man had been traveling south on Isles Road on a 1983 Honda motorcycle when he collided with a groundhog, also known as a woodchuck. The man lost control of his bike and was thrown from it.    Sanilac EMS transported the man to McKenzie Memorial Hospital for treatment of injuries, the nature of which deputies did not specify.    Alcohol was not a factor and the rider was not wearing a helmet.
